channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

[+2864] First things first...

[+1679] Stephen Hawking: "Humans Have Entered New Stage of Evolution
item.description: Although It has taken homo sapiens several million years to evolve from the apes, the useful information in our DNA, has probably changed by only a few million bits. So the rate of biological evolution in humans, Stephen Hawking points...

item.title: [+1632] Popular Religions in a nutshell (GRAPH)
item.description: Do you know the difference between Christianity, Judaism, Islam, and Sociology? This graph may help you attain nirvana.

item.title: [+1548] MacBook Pro Only Displays Thousands of Colors
item.description: In a machine labeled a “MacBook Pro,” you’d think they’d cater to, well I don’t know, professionals?

item.title: [+1489] Blind man sees after having a TOOTH implanted in right eye
item.description: A blind man is able to see his wife for the first time - after having a tooth implanted into his eye.

item.title: [+1321] 55 Massively Demotivational Car Posters
item.description: 55 demotivationals, all pertaining to car culture.

item.title: [+1317] In Case Of Zombies Break Glass [Pic]
[+1280] Jon Stewart Blasts Glenn Beck & Michael Scheuer
item.description: Hey, you remember a couple of days ago when Michael Scheuer appeared on the "Glenn Beck Whirligig Of Freakjuice" to talk about border security, and he said that "the only chance we have as a country right now is for Osama bin Laden to deploy and detonate a major weapon in the United States."

item.title: [+1242] Man stares death in the face, and then takes a picture of it
[+1229] Alaska Governor Sarah Palin will not run for re-election
item.description: Palin has scheduled a 3 p.m. ET news conference at her home in Wasilla. The governor’s office offered no further details about the subject of the news conference, but the sources tells CNN that Palin will announce her decision to forgo another run.

item.title: [+1214] Expose: Goldman Sachs behind every market crash since 1920s
item.description: Investment bank Goldman Sachs had a crucial role to play in every market bubble and crash since the Great Depression, says a new article. Goldman not only made money when asset prices were going up -- by hedging their bets, they made money on the way down, too.

item.title: [+1191] A Drug That Could Give You Perfect Visual Memory
item.description: Imagine if you could look at something once and remember it forever. You would never have to ask for directions again. Now a group of scientists has isolated a protein that mega-boosts your ability to remember what you see.

item.title: [+1128] OMG!! Fish With Human Teeth.
item.description: This incredible fish was found with unique human-like teeth :O

item.title: [+1090] Colbert Tells Viewers To Deny Rep. Cynthia Davis Food w/vid
item.description: The latest insanity from wingnut Republicans: opposing subsidizing school lunches for low income children because ... wait for it ... "hunger can be a positive motivator". Colbert mops the floor with her (with video goodness).

item.title: [+1063] Soulja Boy Threatens to Quit
item.description: Soulja Boy had some frustration to get off his chest on Wednesday night, so he launched into a 2-hour Twitter tirade about "crackers" and his struggles as an artist.

item.title: [+996] Is Sesame Street's Count a Vulgar Sex Addict?
item.description: The Count comes clean about his obsession?

item.title: [+811] Girls: He Tricked Us Into Sex With Tarot Cards
item.description: A man's accused of using Tarot cards and mysticism to lure three teenage girls into having sex.

item.title: [+773] Goldman Sachs created every major economic bubble since 1930
item.description: They use the same playbook over and over again: Goldman positions itself in the middle of a speculative bubble, selling investments they know are crap. When it all goes bust, leaving millions of ordinary citizens broke and starving, they begin the entire process over again.
